level.heading: Appointment of guardian ad litem.
level.text: If it appears to the Court that there is an apparent conflict between an interested person under a legal disability and a person described in section 20-101(d)(2)(A), the Court may, in its discretion, appoint a guardian ad litem for the person with a legal disability.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 16-305 substituted "person with a legal disability" for "legally disabled person".

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 3-72
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 3-72, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 20-101.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 16-305
level.text: Law 16-305, the "People First Respectful Language Modernization Act of 2006", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 16-664, which was referred to Committee on the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 20, 2006, and July 11, 2006, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 17, 2006, it was assigned Act No. 16-437 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 16-305 became effective on April 24, 2007.
